intro: Schivereckia monticola, commonly known as the mountain schivereckia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
